main event: Multiple lights with alternating red and green colors were observed over Cape Wales, Alaska on February 2, 1951.
interesting points: The lights were observed for a total of 2 hours and were reported to be on a bearing of 242 degrees from the observation station., No physical structure was visible with the lights., The lights disappeared for 1 hour before reappearing and could not be seen clearly due to fog., Sighting included reports of lights seen from a distance of about 1000 yards., A recent sighting on February 18 involved 14 lights moving at estimated speeds of 1000 mph.
witness description: Officer in charge Powell of Weather Bureau Airways Station Wales
